00022 /**

00027  * @brief  Program for doing regression test on mas5 data.

00031 //
00032 #include "util/CalvinChpCheck.h"
00033 #include "util/ChpCheck.h"
00034 #include "util/Convert.h"
00035 #include "util/Fs.h"
00036 #include "util/FsTestDir.h"
00037 #include "util/RegressionTest.h"
00038 #include "util/Util.h"
00039 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00040 //
00041 #include <cstring>
00042 #include <string>
00043 #include <vector>
00044 //
00045 
00046 using namespace std;
00047 
00048 class Mas5Test
00049 {
00050 
00051 public:
00052   int numPassed, numFailed;
00053   std::string testDir;
00054   Mas5Test()
00055   {
00056     numPassed = 0;
00057     numFailed = 0;
00058   }
00059   void doU133Calvin();
00060   void doU133Xda();
00061 };
00062 
00063 void Mas5Test::doU133Calvin()
00064 {
00065   string name = "doU133Calvin";
00066   string command = "./apt-mas5 -c ../../../regression-data/data/lib/HG-U133_Plus_2/HG-U133_Plus_2.cdf --cel-files=../../../regression-data/data/mas5/cel-files.txt  -o " + testDir + "/" + name;
00067 
00068   string chpFilesSuffix = ".chp";
00069   const char *chpFiles[] = {
00070                 "heart-rep1",
00071                 "heart-rep2",
00072                 "heart-rep3",
00073                 "hela-rep1",
00074                 "hela-rep2",
00075                 "hela-rep3",
00076                 "pancrease-rep1",
00077                 "pancrease-rep2",
00078                 "pancrease-rep3",
00079                 NULL
00080   };
00081 
00082   vector<RegressionCheck *> checks;
00083   vector<string> gold,gen;
00084   gold = Util::addPrefixSuffix(chpFiles, "../../../regression-data/data/mas5/"+name+"/", chpFilesSuffix);
00085   gen = Util::addPrefixSuffix(chpFiles, Fs::join( testDir ,  name) + "/", chpFilesSuffix);
00086   ///@todo APT-378: fix win32 differences in mean signal for P/A/M/All probesets
00087   // Check including headers at lower eps to deal with win32 differences
00088   checks.push_back(new CalvinChpCheck(gen, gold, 0, L"apt-", 0.001, true, 0.0));
00089   // Check not including headers at higher stringency
00090   checks.push_back(new CalvinChpCheck(gen, gold, 0, L"apt-", 0.0001, false, 0.0));
00091 
00092   RegressionTest test(name, command.c_str(), checks);
00093   Verbose::out(1, "Doing " + name + "()");
00094   if(!test.pass())
00095   {
00096     Verbose::out(1, "Error in Mas5Test::"+name+"(): " + test.getErrorMsg());
00097     numFailed++;
00098   }
00099   else
00100   {
00101     numPassed++;
00102   }
00103 }
00104 
00105 void Mas5Test::doU133Xda()
00106 {
00107   string name = "doU133Xda";
00108   string command = "./apt-mas5 -c ../../../regression-data/data/lib/HG-U133_Plus_2/HG-U133_Plus_2.cdf --cc-chp-output=false --xda-chp-output=true --cel-files=../../../regression-data/data/mas5/cel-files.txt  -o " + testDir + "/" + name;
00109 
00110   string chpFilesSuffix = ".chp";
00111   const char *chpFiles[] = {
00112                 "heart-rep1",
00113                 "heart-rep2",
00114                 "heart-rep3",
00115                 "hela-rep1",
00116                 "hela-rep2",
00117                 "hela-rep3",
00118                 "pancrease-rep1",
00119                 "pancrease-rep2",
00120                 "pancrease-rep3",
00121                 NULL
00122   };
00123 
00124   vector<RegressionCheck *> checks;
00125   vector<string> gold,gen;
00126   gold = Util::addPrefixSuffix(chpFiles, "../../../regression-data/data/mas5/"+name+"/", chpFilesSuffix);
00127   gen = Util::addPrefixSuffix(chpFiles, Fs::join(testDir, name) + "/", chpFilesSuffix);
00128   ///@todo APT-378: fix win32 differences in mean signal for P/A/M/All probesets
00129   // Check including headers at lower eps to deal with win32 differences
00130   checks.push_back(new ChpCheck(gen, gold, 0, "apt-",1,true,0.0));
00131 
00132   RegressionTest test(name, command.c_str(), checks);
00133   Verbose::out(1, "Doing " + name + "()");
00134   if(!test.pass())
00135   {
00136     Verbose::out(1, "Error in Mas5Test::"+name+"(): " + test.getErrorMsg());
00137     numFailed++;
00138   }
00139   else
00140   {
00141     numPassed++;
00142   }
00143 }
00144 
00145 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00146 {
00147   try {
00148     FsTestDir testDir;
00149     testDir.setTestDir("mas5-stat/mas5", true);
00150     Mas5Test test;
00151     test.testDir = testDir.asString();
00152     
00153     Verbose::setLevel(2);
00154 
00155     test.doU133Calvin();
00156     test.doU133Xda();
00157 
00158     Verbose::out(1, "NumPassed: " + ToStr(test.numPassed) + " NumFailed: " + ToStr(test.numFailed));
00159     return test.numFailed != 0;
00160   }
00161   catch(...) {
00162       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00163       return 1;
00164   }
00165   return 1;
00166 }
